attributes.action: Repeat: invoke Article 50 of The Lisbon Treaty immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133618

"Invoke Article 50 of The Lisbon Treaty immediately.

The British people have spoken. We have voted to leave the EU. We want article 50 of the Lisbon treaty to be invoked immediately. We still have two years to discuss our exit from the EU, but we do not wish to delay it any further."

Government response:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133618?reveal_response=yes

"Article 50 should not be invoked before the end of this year."
attributes.background: In petition #133618, we wrote: "Invoke Article 50 of The Lisbon Treaty immediately. The British people have spoken. We want article 50 of the Lisbon treaty to be invoked immediately." The Government's response wants to kick the will of the people into the long grass. We do not accept your response.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/133618

Petitions stay open on the site for six months. We can't accept a petition calling for the same action while the existing petition is still open. 

If you would like to share your views of the Government's response directly with the Government, you can write to the Department for Exiting the EU at dexeu.correspondence@cabinetoffice.gov.uk

Petition 133618 will be considered by the Petitions Committee (a cross-party group of MPs, independent of the Government) at its meeting on Tuesday 6 September.
